headline.main: Mr. Everett and the Attack upon Senator Sumner.

docs.lead_paragraph: The comments of the Southern press upon Mr. EVERETT'S action in reference to the assault of PRESTON S. BROOKS upon Senator SUMNER, has led to the publication of the following letter from him upon the subject: MEDFORD, Mass., Oct. 31.
docs.snippet: The comments of the Southern press upon Mr. EVERETT'S action in reference to the assault of PRESTON S. BROOKS upon Senator SUMNER, has led to the publication of the following letter from him upon the subject: MEDFORD, Mass., Oct. 31.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Persia Again--Note from Mr. Cunard. Fires. Another Reply to Mr. Denyse. IN FOURTEENTH-STREET.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times : SIR: In a letter from Mr. W. C. DENYSE, in the TIMES of this morning, on the subject of the Persia at Quarantine, he says: " I would add that while I was detained on board the steamer, several persons, among others Mr. CUNARD, were permitted by Capt. JUDKINS to come on board and to leave the vessel."
docs.abstract: Arrest of Capt Judkins of the Persia

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM MEXICO.; Flight of Juarez and his Cabinet--Success of the Revolutionists--Fall of Zacatecas--Vera Cruz the Provisional Seat of Government. Continued Anarchy in the Country.
BROOKLYN COMMON COUNCIL; The Committees-Swill Milk.

docs.lead_paragraph: A regular meeting of this Board was held last evening, President Kalbfleish in the Chair. After the reading and approving the minutes, the Chair announced the Standing Committees for the year as follows: On Laws and Applications to the Legislature--Messrs. Pierson, Douglass, Backhouse. On Opening Streets--Messrs. Greene, McDonald, Wilson.

docs.lead_paragraph: NEW BUILDINGS.--A large warehouse is about to be erected for Mr. JOHN STEWART, Jr., fronting on State. Bridge and Pearl streets, extending 125 feet on the first, 60 feet on the second, and 50 feet on the last mentioned street. The building will be of fine Philadelphia brick, with sand-stone facings. The site which it will occupy is at No. 15 State-street and No. I Pearl-street.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Hayes, late of the Philadelphia firm of Hayes Dreer, has bequeathed $50,000 for the foundation of an asylum for aged mechanics in Philadelphia. The institution is to receive the title of "Hayes' Mechanics' Home;" nine gentlemen are named as trustees, and large sums in addition to the legacy are promised by wealthy Philadelphians.

headline.main: Quarantine Affairs--Custom-House Arrest of Captain Judkins.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrest of Captain JUDKINS, of the Persia, on the complaint of the Revenue Inspectors, alleging that the Captain, in carrying out the orders of the Health Officer, obstructed them in the lawful discharge of their duties, is likely to engage the serious attention of the City Government, as well as that of the Custom-House Department.
docs.abstract: Arrest of Capt Judkins of the Persia

docs.lead_paragraph: SERIOUS ACCIDENT.---On Saturday afternoon last, a child of THOS. R. DAILY, No. 73 South Third street, fell from a second story window of its father's residence to the pavement, and sustained serious in juries. DARING ROBBERY.-The house occupied by BENJAMIN WRANG, corner of Myrtle-avenue and Jaystreet, was entered by thieves on Saturday afternoon, and robbed of property valued at $400, $200 in gold coin, about $50 in silver coin, and two watches. docs.lead_paragraph: It is commonly supposed that the public has a tolerably effectual guarantee against the culpable carelessness of railroad companies, in the power of suing them for damages for injuries sustained-and so a simple and clear statement of the law on the subject would certainly warrant any one in believing.
